newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: ABB, Fisa receive Bahrain power plant contract.
newsitem.headline: ABB, Fisa receive Bahrain power plant contract.

text.p: Bahrain has awarded a deal for a power and water project worth 171 million dinars ($453.6 million) to ABB AG/AS and Fisa Italiampianti of Italy, local newspapers said on Monday.
They said the contract, signed in Bahrain on Sunday, involves the supply, installation and commissioning of two gas turbines with total capacity of 280 megawatts.
The plant will also produce 30 million gallons per day of distilled water. The first gas turbine is expected to come on stream in April 1999.
The plant will be built in Hidd, a village on Muharraq island which is linked with the capital Manama by a three km (1.8 miles) causeway.
"ABB will start work on the project on reclaimed land in Hidd later this year," Bahrain's Gulf Daily News quoted Electricity and Water Minister Abdullah Mohammad Jumaa as saying.
"Under the contract, the money will be repaid by the government to ABB over 12 years," he said but gave no details.
Jumaa also said Bahrain would spend 60 million dinars to link the plant with the country's power network and the island would negotiate with Arab funds to finance the project.
